content.div:
We've been on a search for a product that straightens our hair, cuts down on drying time and eliminates frizz. This week, we tested LaCoupe's orgnx Brazilian Keratin 14 Day Smoothing Treatment and Aftercare Collection. The kit promises to effortlessly achieve long-lasting salon results, reduce of frizz and give us smooth, silky hair.

The products range from $9.99-$12.99 and are available exclusively at Shoppers Drugmart.

Have you tried it? Leave your own review in the comments section below.

--

"Kinky-curls transformed into hair that's smooth and straight? Sure, I maintained that look for 14 days while using La Coupe Orgnx's Brazilian Keratin Complex system. But let's consider some of the styling instructions, first: six bottles of sweet, herbal-scented goo aren't going to Cher-ify your hair. A regular blitz of blow-drying and flat-ironing is what's going to produce results -- and as the instructions for step 1 of the system, the 14-Day Styling Cream, suggest, you’d better be giving each section of hair "4-5" swipes of the flat iron. Even curls as tight as mine will go sleek with less firepower.

But yes, the products: in a weird twist, I'd recommend any of them to curly girls (or otherwise) who love their flat-irons. All except one of them -- and it’s the item at the centre of this whole system, the 14 Day Smoothing Cream. It gave me the look, sure. But it also gave me a nasty case of product build-up -- one so bad that I couldn't run my fingers through my hair. The recommended 48-hour waiting period between shampoos became socially awkward agony. (When one friend cooed, trying to play with my transformed locks, I recoiled. Nobody likes having to admit their coif is the texture of wet cotton candy.)

Thankfully, the shampoo/conditioner combo rinsed the gunk out (after three washings). Subsequent stylings were incident-free, thanks to the system's satisfactory heat-spray, blowout styling cream and conditioning masque. (The latter, incidentally, was my absolute favourite of the bunch; you'll be hard-pressed to find a better detangler.) Rating: 2/5.

--Leah Collins/Dose.ca

--

"I have naturally curly hair and am inherently lazy, so any product that helps me maintain straight hair with very little effort is aces in my books! Not that this process was a total cake walk; though the results lasted a while, the application was intense. I started with the clarifying shampoo, which strips product/toxins out of your hair. Since I couldn't follow it up with conditioner, brushing through the tangles was a headache (literally). But eventually I got to a stage where I could run gobs of the smoothing treatment through my towel-dried tresses. I slathered it all over my shoulder-length hair and barely managed to use half the tube, which means I'll be able to repeat the application at least one more time without buying another kit (bonus!).

After leaving it on for an hour, I washed it out and then followed the very detailed instructions, blow-drying my hair meticulously and then straight-ironing it, going over each section multiple times. The result was soft, shiny, pin-straight hair (though I'm sure with that much blow-drying/straightening, I could have achieved the same results without the pre-treatment).

The real test came two days later. I had yet to wash my hair (as per instructed) and I got caught in a snowstorm without a hat. Usually, once a sprinkle hits my head, my hair curls up in a way that would make Annie blush, but when I came indoors and brushed the snow out of my hair, my locks were still as straight as before and I was completely frizz-free. Impressive!

Unfortunately, the results didn't last 14 days as promised, but I still managed to make it about a week before my natural waves/frizz crept back.

The kit comes with a whole lot of product, much of which I didn't use. It includes sulfate-free shampoo and conditioner (though after a few days I switched back to my regular product, which is also sulfate-free but without Orgnx’s sickeningly sweet scent) and flatiron spray (which I didn't use because the product worked so well, I was usually able to get by with just a quick blow-dry). I did, however, use the blowstyling cream before each blow-dry.

In the end, I ended up investing about an hour of application time (treatment, blow-drying, and flat-ironing) for approximately one week of straight, frizz-free hair. It still required quick blow-dries, but I was able to cut out my usual flat-ironing step altogether. Since I'd rather spend some weekend time prepping my hair than flat-ironing it every morning, I'd definitely try this again (especially before vacationing in humid climates). The low price point doesn't hurt, either." Rating: 3.5/5

-Jen McDonnell

--

"I blow-dry and flat-iron my hair almost every day, and I envy women with long, naturally straight hair. I dream of the day I can let my hair air-dry without a thick layer of frizz. My hair is naturally curly, frizzy and generally unattractive (think 80’s rock band), so I was thrilled to try out the LaCoupe orgnx 14 Day Keratin Smoothing Treatment. I was tired of blowing out my hair for 45 minutes to get it only partially straight, and then having to go over each section with a flat-iron for that perfect, smooth look.

The application was relatively easy, providing you follow the instructions diligently. I have a lot of hair and it’s quite long, so the entire process took about an hour and half. I wanted to make sure my hair was perfectly smooth, with no rogue kinks or curls, so my drying time took longer than I expected.

After the treatment, my hair looked and felt amazing. It was softer, silkier, and overall more manageable than usual. Even after a few washes, the treatment cut my drying time in half, as I didn’t have to go over each section of hair multiple times to get it straight. The blowout styling cream and heat protectant spray worked wonders to keep my hair frizz-free over the 14 days. I even let my hair air-dry a few times (which I usually wouldn’t dare to do, and it dried curly and shiny with very minimal frizz. I did notice towards the end of the 14 days that my hair was slowly returning back to its original state, but depending on how often you wash your hair, it could last longer.

I would definitely try this collection again. The prices of each product can’t be beat when compared to the cost of a pricey salon keratin treatment." Rating: 4.5/5

-Jenna Downing

link.Abstract: It's that time of year again: our parents are cheering while we're wiping away the mascara-stained tears from our faces and heading back to school. To make things a little easier this year, we're helping you pass Beauty 101 by recapping this year’s best-reviewed beauty products from our Buy or Beware column. Your course schedule might be a mess, but your face won’t be.
link.title: Top 10 Back-to-School Must Have Beauty Items

Whether they’re tricked out with bikini trimmers or gel strips that promise to eliminate the need for shaving cream, these aren’t your mother’s razors. Find out which razors lived up to their claims and which one will be tossed in the trash.

entry.title: Celebrity Beauty Secrets

link.Abstract: We've got the inside scoop on how to get the stars' favourite looks. Find out how they get picture-perfect for the cameras.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Want to get picture perfect bronzed cheeks? Jennifer Lopez's makeup artist, Scott Barnes, told InStyle magazine to be careful where you apply the dust. He said, "No powder around laugh lines, nose, or eyes; it adds darkness and ages you."
link.title: Jennifer Lopez - Celebrity Beauty Secrets

entry.title: Celebrity Makeup Mishaps

link.Abstract: We're used to stars looking glamorous and perfect, but sometimes it just doesn't happen. Check out some classic makeup mistakes made by the rich and famous.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Christina Aguilera's heartfelt performance at Etta James' funeral on Jan. 28, 2012 was overshadowed by her dirrty legs. Streaks of what appeared to be fake tanner ran down the side and front of both her legs.
